title: Problems Last Few Days. Rito Plz
body:
Yesterday, after I patched, I had the game crash/freeze on me completely 3 times. Each time it occurred about 15-20 seconds into the game.
It wasn't a bugsplat, it completely froze my whole PC, so I couldn't even manually (via OS) shut down the program. Hard resets via power button and such were required. Each time it took several minutes for me to try and get the crashed game to close, and then end up restarting PC and client before getting back into the game.
Then the client freaked out after the 3rd game it happened in, and reverted patches, only to update them again.

Just now, I dodged a queue with time on the clock, but when I restarted client to check the timer, the game was in progress but I have a message saying I "have been removed from the party".

This better not count towards leaverbuster penalties, because I have no control over buggy patches that clearly weren't tested before implementation.

replies.body:
Nah Seras, integrated is 'no GPU', it just takes a chunk of normal RAM and uses it for gfx processing.

I have not had this issue recently, so I guess it has been fixed.

Haha all I can say is tech *really* isn't my area, I only know what i've picked up from answering threads and from experience so I'm more than happy to concede on that one. Good to hear your issue is fixed.

It's rather ironic, I've seen less posts about this patch than usual and this is the one that catches you out after so long.

It's a strange one, my best guess would be a bad GPU interaction, but beyond updating your drivers I'm not exactly well versed. I'd definitely hit up player support for that one, tech just isn't my area.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new

GPU? I'm on integrated graphics bro (sharing CPU RAM). I play LoL because it's the only thing that will run without a graphics card.
I might _splash out_ on a new (2nd hand) PC soon.

It's still a GPU, or at least as far as I know it is, they just aren't very beefy because they're smaller and share their GBs.

Anyway in my experience on board/integrated graphics are just as prone to these sort of issues, I played on integrated for a while and ran into such things once or twice.

When buying a PC, second hand or otherwise, just remember, GPU and Power Supply are the things you don't want to cheap out on too much, since one does most of the work, is the easiest to future proof and is usually the worst to replace (cost wise) and the other can take the whole lot down with it if things go wrong.

I am still experiencing issues, brought on by the recent patch.
I played 2-3 years on this same toaster, same internet connection, without this ever happening.

Since last patch, it has happened many times.
Something you have done makes my PC freeze within the first minute or two of games. It never happens late game, only at the start. All I can do is ctrl-alt-delete to bring up task manager, then go to processes (because closing application won't work), and kill it from there.
It freezes my whole PC.

It's the last patch, why do you never test anything properly before implementing it?
